evidence.text:
Person A: You need to change your costume, Shelly!
Person B: They’re right there, sweetie.
Person A: Okay can you please put them on?
Person B: I always forget it’s there.

Person B: I love languages. I can say “Je m’appelle Jodie.” I know how to say “My Name Is Jodie” in five languages.
Person B: --Including English-- Useless?? Are you kidding??

Person B: No like, you’re our mom... and Eddie’s--
Person A: I mean, I guess I think of us as a family.
Person A: I knew when we started sharing our theater, when they took over our Thursday, Friday and Saturday performances, it was a bad sign.

Person A: Did you ever want to get married?
Person B: I was married for a short time when I was really young.
Person A: What happened?
Person B: Oh you know, it didn’t work out-- I was dancing-- I was already in the show here when we met, and he didn’t like it so much-- Vegas. And then he got a job in New York, but the show here was really thriving-- there was a lot of press around us-- it was so exciting and I was very young-- so I stayed here.
Person A: So what did you do?
Person B: We tried to make it work for a couple years but he eventually met someone there. He asked me if I’d consider trying to dance in New York, and I did-- I tried it. I went to an open call for the Rockettes, I went to an open call for a Broadway musical, but... I really, I just missed the thrill of the show here...
Person A: You’d be a perfect Rockette.
Person B: Nah, I found all that kicking very redundant.
Person B: Hey Hannie! Oh I just tried to call you Hannah and honey at the same time-- Hannie-- haha-- anyway, Hi Hannah, honey. Just wanted to check in and say hello and see if you’d want to meet me for a bite or a cup of coffee-- or well, I don’t drink coffee but I could have some tea-- or, what I’d really like is a nice drink but that’s... that’d be inappropriate ‘cause you’re only... you’re not old enou-- you’re only twenty... oh shit. Oh shit, you’re twenty two-- oh my god, how do I delete this thing...?

Person B: Hey Hannie! Oh I just tried to call you Hannah and honey at the same time-- Hannie-- haha-- anyway, Hi Hannah, honey. Just wanted to check in and say hello and see if you’d want to meet me for a bite or a cup of coffee-- or well, I don’t drink coffee but I could have some tea-- or, what I’d really like is a nice drink but that’s... that’d be inappropriate ‘cause you’re only... you’re not old enou-- you’re only twenty... oh shit. Oh shit, you’re twenty two-- oh my god, how do I delete this thing...?
Person B: Well, Mary-Anne, you think it’s so terrible, why are you here? Why did you want this job in the first place you think it’s so tasteless?

Person B: Sorry sweetie.
Person A: It’s okay.

Person B: Sweetie, you don’t even want those shows, they’re so bad, they’re low class--
Person B: Oh my god, Hannah! What a nice surprise! Come on in! What are you doing here?

Person A: Hey sweetie. What are you doing here?
Person B: Shelly, I’m really scared-- I didn’t know I could never go back--

Person A: I just wanted to call you-- I want to talk to you-- I can’t believe I left the way I did the other night, I just feel so terrible.
Person A: I’m so glad you feel so necessary here, Jodie-- that’s good. That’s important.

Person A: Will you just help me with my damn wings??
Person B: Nope.

Person A: You should have thought of this pointless challenge before the show, so I was ready for it.
Person A: Just what I need, a lesson about character from a nineteen year old.

Person B: Oh you should. You should!
Person B: Really! What’s stopping you? You should do it, you should.
